Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2013 04:00PM iluv2scrub wrote: Susan, sorry you are having so much trouble...I have anzemet premed in my port prior to infusion and then take zofran at home...melt on the tongue zofran. I have ativan but for anxiety. Intake steroids following treatment to avoid inflammation that causes terrible pain in my kidneys and the steroids cause anxiety. I am sure you can dial in the right meds for you, hang in there and keep trying. Kathy

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2014 02:12PM iluv2scrub wrote: I was confused by the Bump too...and if one puts the topic in their "favorites", it doesn't matter if it is kept active by a "bump" or not...it's just easy to get to and only the important information shows up on pages...I stopped checking the topic when I was in chemo because of all the "bump-filled pages" that did not help me....alas...I made it and I get my port out in a couple weeks - YAY!!!  I know a lot of you know how that feels!!!! For those of you just starting chemo...please feel free to send me a private message - I used that a lot because I found it difficult to follow some threads - I'll blame it on chemo-brain hahaha...I earned it so I'm claiming it!  Chemo is do-able...it sucks and there are a lot of side effects to deal with but it's all do-able!  Hang in there!  Happy to private message or email anytime! Kathy

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2013 10:21AM iluv2scrub wrote: Dear Oak Tree...as someone else said, you are stronger than you think. I will say, waiting is the worst part of my experience so far. My FNA results were "on time" but then my post op report was two days later than the surgeon said. I had surgery on a Friday (Feb.1) and expected results Wed. I called Wed. afternoon..and called Thurs. at noon...and called Fri. a.m. to find the office closed!!! I PAGED the surgeon! I got a call within 30 min. and they explained there were two reports they had wait for and mine would be ready by 3:30...then finally...Friday of last week I learned I need chemo. Waiting from Wed to Fri just about killed me. We do have to advocate for ourselves. I hope you get your results soon! I know the waiting is so hard! But I am traveling this cancer road and stop-lights are something I have to get used to...now I know I need chemo but am waiting to see the oncologist to find out what my cocktail will be...I want to start today but I can't...baseline PET and bone scans, port placement and waiting for appointments. So so so hard to wait at these stoplights when I want to keep driving. Advocate for yourself in a professional manner and keep your head held high...I wish you good news but if it is not, we are here for you! (Hug)
Posts.Title: It's been a week, no results, I can't take this much longer!!! OldOakTree Moderators
